우리 반에도 있나? 담배 피는 애기들? Are there smokers at my class? 듣기 View video 콬TV (WHYNOT) : 너와 내가 키스한 이유 [연애미수] EP07 재미 있는 일이 생길 때마다 너에게 말해주고 싶었
vlive.english: Are there smokers at my class?

vlive.korean: [엔딩을 해석해보자면 역시 남메피는 잘생겼습니다] 이미 다... [As for interpretation of the ending, he's handsome] It's already been... 듣기 View video V PICK! : [INFINITE] 식목일날 나무 심장에 전세로 입주할게요 보증금 받으세요 (Woo Hyun's V before Mephisto)
vlive.english: [As for interpretation of the ending, he's handsome] It's already been...

vlive.korean: 이제 꽃 피는... 제 생일 때가 벚꽃이 제일 절정일 때 아니에요? Now, flowers bloom... Aren't cherry blossoms at their peak during my birthday? 듣기 View video OH MY GIRL : 오랜만이죠~
vlive.english: Now, flowers bloom... Aren't cherry blossoms at their peak during my birthday?

vlive.korean: 그렇게 막내가 외치고 외쳤던 꽃피는 봄이 오잖아요? So the spring that blooms flowers that the youngest has been singing about is here, right? 듣기 View video fromis_9 : 지쎈왔다🐳
vlive.english: So the spring that blooms flowers that the youngest has been singing about is here, right?

examples.korean: The place where optimism most flourishes is the lunatic asylum. (Havelock Ellis) 듣기 Add to Wordbook 낙관론이 가장 많이 꽃피는 곳은 정신병원이다. (해브록 엘리스 , 희망명언) 명언/속담
examples.english: The place where optimism most flourishes is the lunatic asylum. (Havelock Ellis) Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: If music be the food of love, play on; Give me excess of it, that, surfeiting, The appetite may sicken, and so die. That strain again! it had a dying fall: O, it came o'er my ear like the sweet sound That breathes upon a bank of violets, Stealing and giving odour! (William Shakespeare) 듣기 Add to Wordbook 음악이 사랑을 살찌우는 양식이라면 계속해다오. 질리도록 들어 싫증이 나버리면 사랑의 식욕도 또한 사라지고 말 것이 아니냐. 다시 한 번 들려다오. 아스라이 사라지는 선율, 귓가에 감미롭게 들린다. 흡사 제비꽃 피는 언덕 위의 미풍이 몰래 꽃향기를 훔쳐 싣고 오는 것 같다. (윌리엄 셰익스피어 , 음악명언) 명언/속담
examples.english: If music be the food of love, play on; Give me excess of it, that, surfeiting, The appetite may sicken, and so die. That strain again! it had a dying fall: O, it came o'er my ear like the sweet sound That breathes upon a bank of violets, Stealing and giving odour! (William Shakespeare) Add to Wordbook
